Topic.Title: To whom it may concern.

Message.Msg: Keep on buying. Forget the past the future is all that matters. After years of being a punchline in a joke, the Yahoo longs mantra #you can´t lose buying Yahoo# is coming true... Alibaba Group is exceeding all expectations. If Alibaba Group goes public in 2013 it will be for $700 billion or more. If Alibaba Group goes public in 2014 it will be for $1000 billion or more. Yahoo will get $140 billion or $200 billion respectively. Yahoo has become a prime takeover target. Yahoo will have $120 billion in cash and 20% of Alibaba Group. A stock buyback, special dividend and huge acquisitions in ad tech and mobile are certain with billions more flooding in.

Topic.Title: Who is short Yahoo?

Message.Msg: I'm not invested in YHOO one way or the other, but I use their stock message boards, and if the lack of oversight or management of the boards (the boards are overrun with spam) is any indication of how they run the company, shorting the stock would seem like a wise decision. If they make their money through advertising, and they drive their legitimate traffic away by allowing spammers galore, they will become a complete non-entity on the web. JMHO

Topic.Title: To whom it may concern.

Message.Msg: Buy, Buy and buy. Buy as much as you can. Yahoo was at $16.37 last month, hit over $18 last year and saw the $19s the year before. No reason for Yahoo not to go much higher. Look at all the positives; billions from Alibaba, more from Yahoo Japan, special dividend, super smart huge acquisitions in ad tech and mobile, upgrades, lottery winnings and buyout offers coming. How can you not spend your last penny on Yahoo?
